author: gakonst
content: Hi folks, we are trying to figure out what the right subset of EOF we could ship in a reasonable amount of time for the Reth side, and came here looking for some guidance/advice. I wonder what EIPs do people think are part of "MVP" that we could ship in Prague 2024 alongside some other EL EIPs like 2537, 7002, 6110? (We think it's going to be hard to ship Verkle in 2024 so thinking of that separately)

author: draganrakita
content:
I see three `EOF` EIPs that can be maybe seen as out of scope: 
`SWAPN/DUP` is not part of `EOF` but it is very desired and easy to add so we definitely want to include it.
`JUMPF` i dont understand how impactful this is?
And third one is `Revamped CALL` that seems that it can be shipped later as it just adds new CALL instructions.

author: draganrakita
content: This list + `EOF - Data section access instructions` seems necessary to ship together and best act as one group. Is this okay to reason it in that way?

author: _shemnon
content: Stripped call is essential for the MVP.  The goal is to remove gas observability and we cannot do that with the old calls.  The impl is very simple.  This is our one good opportinity to remove gas observability.

author: _shemnon
content: The container parsing and code validation are the "elephant" that must fit through the door.  The opcodes are much smaller to implement.

author: _shemnon
content: SWAPN/DUPN/EXCHANGE are part of the current omnibus spec - https://github.com/ipsilon/eof/blob/main/spec/eof.md
